name: FeederBotforTweets
0:
”Alexa, open feeder bot”
”Alexa, ask feeder bot for help.”
”Alexa, ask feeder bot, how to use it”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: feeder bot
Developer Terms of Use
des:
It enables the Alexa users to listens to the latest tweets by the Twitter users you add, from Alexa app. Using Artificial Intelligence API, it describes the description of the photos uploaded on Twitter. Detects retweets, URLs & Videos.

Login: No need to enter your Twitter credentials. For simplicity, We register the email IDs if it's not present already. If it's there we log in the user.

How to Use:

On Alexa App, login to our system and add twitter usernames by searching after successful login. Then tap on "Link My Account" button to finish the process. If linking is successful then you are done.

Now in Alexa Enabled device, you can say,

"Alexa, open feeder bot". It will read the latest tweets from the usernames already added while enabling the skill in Alexa App.

You can add/delete usernames at below link.

https://www.linklyapps.in/alexa/alexaLogin.php

While visiting above link no need to link account, if already linked. For account linking, disable the skill and then enable again.

It detects the image or photo that was shared with the tweet and by using Artificial Intelligence, it gathers names of the objects present in the photo and reads it to users.

It detects whether its a retweet. It reads the full tweet by saying the name of the person whose tweet is being retweeted.

It also detects whether any URL was shared. Our system converts the tiny URLs to readable hostnames.

It also detects whether any video was uploaded. It reads the description of the thumbnail of the video. 

Future Enhancements:

Allowing the users to listen to the tweets one by one. The user can say, "Next", to skip the current tweet and go to the next. 

Detect Mentions.
Detect Hashtags.
Play again.
Replay.
and More.
